thread.title: Coburn Technologies and Kowa American Announce Distribution Agreement
thread.title_full: Coburn Technologies and Kowa American Announce Distribution Agreement

title: Coburn Technologies and Kowa American Announce Distribution Agreement
text: By Staff Friday, September 4, 2015 12:21 AM Alex Incera (l), president of Coburn and Reid Anthony, president and CEO of Kowa American Corp. SOUTH WINDSOR, Conn.— Coburn Technologies and Kowa American Corp. have entered into agreement that allows Coburn to distribute Kowa’s complete line diagnostic products in the U.S., beginning Sept. 1, 2015. Kowa’s diagnostic line includes the Nonmyd WX3D Retinal Camera, the Nonmyd 7 Fundus Camera and the HA-2 Applanation Tonometer.“Kowa has a tremendous product offering, and like Coburn, the company places an emphasis on technology and service, so it’s a good fit for us,” said Alex Incera, president of Coburn. “The Kowa line complements our popular Huvitz line of refractors/keratometers, slit lamps, projectors, lensmeters, digital refractors and surgical microscopes so that we are able to offer a complete range of products and solutions to the eyecare professional.”Reid Anthony, president and CEO of Kowa American Corp., remarked, “We are excited to partner with Coburn Technologies. We believe their access to the eyecare professional market through their extensive sales organization and their 60 years of leading industry experience combined with our products and technology is a winning combination. Kowa and Coburn Technologies share a focus on developing innovative technologies and cost effective solutions for the eyecare professional.”Coburn Technologies will showcase Kowa’s products at this month’s Vision Expo West in Las Vegas. ALSO RECOMMENDED
